intro: Trachys deccanensis, commonly known as the Deccan Trachys, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Trachys deccanensis is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
